data.title: THE END OF THE DREAM
data.meta_description: Garden City: Doubleday & Company, Inc., 1972. Octavo, cloth. First edition. A fine ecological catastrophe novel written by Wylie shortly before his death in October of 1971. ... nearly all of mankind is wiped from the Earth early in the twenty-first century by killing industrial smog, poisonous radioactivity, famines caused by ecological abuses ... Wylie's theme, one his writings have sermonized in many forms
data.text:
Wylie, Philip. THE END OF THE DREAM. Garden City: Doubleday & Company, Inc., 1972. Octavo, cloth. First edition. A fine ecological catastrophe novel written by Wylie shortly before his death in October of 1971. "... nearly all of mankind is wiped from the Earth early in the twenty-first century by killing industrial smog, poisonous radioactivity, famines caused by ecological abuses ... Wylie's theme, one his writings have sermonized in many forms throughout his long career, is that outraged Nature takes revenge." - Berger, Science fiction and the New Dark Age, pp. 42-3. Anatomy of Wonder (1987) 4-617. Sargent, British and American Utopian Literature, 1516-1985, Additions. A fine copy in fine dust jacket with touch of age-darkening. (#5545).

Price: $75.00
